page.title: 13BURWASH FIRE STATION
page.content: The Fire Station is down Ham Lane, it has red doors, a light and a telephone box. My Dad is a fireman, there are seven firemen in the local brigade. They attend lots of fires at Mayfield, Heathfield, Battle and Burwash. There is a tower to hang the hoses from so that they can dry out thoroughly. The fire-engine is a Dennis, it was made at the Hester Dennis Works in Guildford. The engine is red all over but the siren light glows blue and it flashes a warning to people to get out of the way. The fire-engine doesn't have very much trouble getting out of Burwash. The other day there was a really huge barn fire and my dad went out again just after he had got in. He didn't return until seven o'clock the next morning. All the firemen cover for each other if they want to go out.
